keyword: calories in hot and sour soup
title: Calories in Hot and Sour Soup
meta_description: Discover calories in hot and sour soup per cup, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium details, and easy tweaks for your bowl.
h1: Calories in Hot and Sour Soup
assumptions: Restaurant-style with tofu, mushrooms, bamboo shoots, egg, vinegar, and cornstarch thickener; about 240 ml per cup.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, restaurant, portion size, and ingredients; homemade versions may differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of hot and sour soup provides ~130 kcal, with moderate protein and high sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add extra firm tofu (1 oz per cup)
Homemade with reduced oil and cornstarch

faqs.q: How many calories in hot and sour soup per cup?
faqs.a: About 130 kcal for a standard 1-cup serving.

faqs.q: Is hot and sour soup low in calories?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 100-150 kcal per cup, making it a lighter soup option.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in hot and sour soup?
faqs.a: Around 900 mg per cup, so watch intake if on a low-sodium diet.

faqs.q: How much protein in hot and sour soup?
faqs.a: Approximately 6 g per cup, mainly from tofu and egg.

faqs.q: Does hot and sour soup have carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, about 12 g per cup from cornstarch and vegetables.
